name: Hotel Annalena

reviews.title: Average hotel with good service
reviews.text: Hotel in old monastery with some simple frescoes. Quiet simple rooms to the garden, but no access for the guests. Good location near the Ponte Vecchio and kind service. Price acceptable (120 euro for a double room).

reviews.title: Pity about the steps
reviews.text: This hotel/pension is in the old part of Florence inside the city walls on a narrow street opposite the Boboli Gardens and near the Pitti Palace of the Medici. A little further on is the Ponte Vecchio.

reviews.title: Would use Annalena again
reviews.text: We stayed here for 2 nights in May 2007 and the greatest shock was the flight of 25+ stone steps we had to negotiate with our luggage, this was not mentioned on the hotel website. A building with such an ancient history, going all the way back to the Medicis, may be very restricted on what updating is permitted. However, a removable heavyweight triangular slope on each step should be considered, would not detract from the character of the building and be of great assistance to the traveller with heavy luggage.

reviews.title: Ok, but expensive
reviews.text: The shower area had a flat base without sides with the result that the whole floor got wet after use. The room and bedding were clean and the beds comfortable, the breakfast was adequate. The reception area had a TV, comfortable seating, a selection of Guide books on Florence which could be borrowed, all the staff were friendly and helpful.

reviews.title: Quiet, peaceful, lovely Hotel Annalena
reviews.text: A perfectly good hotel in a perfectly good location.

reviews.title: Dump of deception
reviews.text: What the Annalena web site says you get:

reviews.title: Good Location Good Room
reviews.text: "All the rooms are very quiet,very elegant and suggestive,but even if the style reminds to the old Florence, there are all the necessary comforts like a private bathroom, tv, phone, minibar, haidryer and air conditioning."

reviews.title: Pensione Annalena is a hidden gem to stay in Florence!
reviews.text: A lovely little hotel on the 2nd floor of a converted Palace, with some rooms with a balcony terrace overlooking lovely gardens (great from breakfast!)

reviews.title: Excellent Hotel
reviews.text: Walking - 3 mins to Pitti Palace & Boboli Gardens, 10 mins to Ponte Vechio and central old city

reviews.title: Decent hotel in a quiet part of Florence
reviews.text: The hotel was beautiful, full of unique art, and in a great location. It's three minutes from the Pitti Palace and Boboli Gardens, five minutes from Ponte Vecchio, and is very close to two bus lines. The hotel was quiet and had a great breakfast (included), but the best part by far was the staff. All staff members we were in contact with were friendly, helpful, and spoke great English. They allowed us to store our bags behind the desk for free for a whole day after we had checked out, and also helped us navigate the bus system.

reviews.title: Nice and decent
reviews.text: The only drawback is that there is no lift, which could be a problem if you have a lot of bags (we had a lot of bags, but didn't find it to be hugely detrimental). Also, my wife would have liked carpeting in the room, but I thought it added to the appeal because the floor was clean and had a very nice pattern.

description: All the rooms are very quiet, very elegant and suggestive, but even if the style reminds to the old Florence, there are all the necessary comforts like a private bathroom, tv, phone, minibar, haidryer and air conditioning.
